trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SEQ_00<tab>Shunye appears concerned for one of his most diligent employees.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SEQ_01<tab>After a bit of prodding from Uvlo, Shunye agrees to task you both with going to Yak T'el, where a meteor once struck the earth. There you are to dig deep into the ground in search of anything which might resemble the Azure Tears.
※Deep earth fragments can be gathered near Iq Br'aax by miners, and near the village of Ilyon Asoh by botanists.
※Minimum collectability rating for this delivery is 240. Delivering items with a rating of 600 or more will earn greater rewards.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SEQ_02<tab>After examining the mineral deposits you deliver, Shunye admits that while there are traces of a deep blue substance, it is still not enough to form a definite conclusion. Although a somewhat disappointing conclusion, you and Uvlo lift Shunye's spirits by reaffirming your dedication to solving the mystery behind his village's fate. The apothecary agrees to move forward, but asks that you wait until he thinks of a better approach than to dig up the entirety of Yak T'el. In the meantime, hone your gathering skills for what is sure to be a challenging search.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_TODO_00<tab><var 08 E4E94511 ((Deliver <var 31 ((ItemMP)) 02F2AB7E0302 /var> gathered near Iq Br'aax to Shunye.)) ((<var 08 E4E94512 ((Deliver <var 31 ((ItemMP)) 02F2AB7E0302 /var> gathered near the village of Ilyon Asoh to Shunye.)) ((As a botanist or miner, deliver <var 31 ((ItemMP)) 02F2AB7E0302 /var> to Shunye.)) /var>)) /var>
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_000<tab>I shall do my utmost under Master Shunye's employ. For now, that is all I can do.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_010<tab>Welcome back to my apothecary, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. I always appreciate you stopping by. We're busy as ever, as you can see.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_011<tab>Although since last we met, Uvlo has been acting strangely.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_012<tab>He brushes off all my attempts to help and works with a singular focus. I think he still believes he crossed a line in asking about my past, and is focusing his efforts more than usual to make up for his perceived affront.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_013<tab>All of which is to say, I've no work for you today.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_014<tab>Well, if our tasks for the day are done, I think we should try to unravel the nature of these “Azure Tears” you found.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_015<tab>...Ah hah, I understand now. You squared away today's work so quickly because you had hoped to employ <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>'s energies on the tears.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_016<tab>Not exactly. Yet I admit the thought did occur to me.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_0017<tab>I have found it difficult to think of aught else as of late...
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_018<tab>What could those stones possibly be?

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_019<tab>Truth be told, I can scarce imagine how we might prove they are connected to a meteor. As difficult as it is for me to admit, Master Shunye, your theory remains just that.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_020<tab>Yet if we were to find similar crystals at another location where meteors had fallen, what then?
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_021<tab>Would that not provide sufficient evidence that the two phenomena are related?
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_022<tab>...I don't think you'll find anything.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_023<tab>I've asked all who would listen if they've seen anything resembling the tears. But even the most worldly of my connections say they are quite singular.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_024<tab>Perhaps they are the only objects of their kind in this world. In that case, they would be rarer than any precious jewel.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_025<tab>I believe your inability to find any information on them gives us all the more reason to look.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_026<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> and I have yet to search for them, after all. And you know our skill at finding the rarest of specimens.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_Q1_000_027<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_A1_000_028<tab>We can't give up yet!
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_A1_000_029<tab>I want to know the truth.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_A1_000_030<tab>We might as well try...
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_031<tab>You, too?
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_032<tab><sigh> Very well, but I'll only make this imposition on you once. You've done enough for me already.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_033<tab>Now, there are several locations in Tural where meteorites have fallen in the past.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_034<tab>The Cexudross crater is purported to be the largest by scholars who study such phenomena.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_035<tab>However, over the years nature has healed the scar left behind. Soil has accumulated, and trees have taken root. Now the area is known as Yak T'el.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_036<tab>But I doubt a little earth and wood can deter you. Somewhere under all that wildlife, you may find material that has lain there since the meteors struck.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_037<tab>If you find something that resembles the tears, then we may be able to solidify a theory of what transpired fifty years ago. We'll know they came from a meteorite, at least.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_038<tab>Well then, let us waste no time. Off to Yak T'el we go.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_040<tab>I'm sorry that you got roped into this, but I'm looking forward to seeing what you can find all the same. What we seek is most likely in Yak T'el─you'll have to dig deep, but I know you're equal to the task.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_050<tab>You actually did it! I wager the earth you found these in hadn't been touched by hands for uncountable years, if at all.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_051<tab>With both your and Uvlo's samples, we may be able to reach a conclusion at last.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_052<tab>Amazing...this is plainly composed of materials entirely different to those found on the surface of Yak T'el. Much more dense...much, much older. And shaped so beautifully, besides...
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_053<tab>You've done well, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. With both your and Uvlo's samples, we may be able to reach a conclusion at last.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_060<tab>Did you discover aught?
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_061<tab>Well, I was able to detect small fragments of a deep blue substance.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_062<tab>And when I shined a light on it, its color did indeed resemble the tears.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_063<tab>But even so, there wasn't enough. As far as my abilities can discern, there's no way to say for certain that the two substances are one and the same.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_064<tab>I see...
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_065<tab>Yet you admit a possibility that they might be related. These are good tidings.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_066<tab>We simply need to keep digging, and eventually we will find a sample large enough to give us a definite conclusion.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_067<tab>I did not expect this journey to be finished after just one outing. I shall return to Yak T'el as many times as it takes.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_068<tab>Why must you do this to yourself, Uvlo?
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_069<tab>You needn't feel obligated to help me resolve this personal matter. At the end of the day, it won't teach you any more about the Shetona...
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_070<tab>...You are correct. I admit that digging deep into the soil is not a task that will help my people thrive.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_071<tab>Yet hearing Uapyota speak with such affection about her family, and seeing you suffer so deeply from the loss of your own, I came to a realization.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_072<tab>Though we may call ourselves by different names, both of our peoples cherish family above all.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_073<tab>If my village suffered the same fate as yours, I would not rest until I found the cause. I could not suffer to live with myself otherwise.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_074<tab>And I know you feel the same.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_075<tab>That is why you still have the tears, even though they hold naught but painful memories. Before, you said that your long years running this shop allowed you to guess that the stones were related to your tragedy.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_076<tab>But I know that deep down, you started this apothecary because you <var 1A 02 /var>knew<var 1A 01 /var> it would bring you closer to an answer.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_UVLO_000_077<tab>As your employee, it is only meet that I should help you achieve this goal. Allow me to help you, Master Shunye.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_078<tab>So reckless you are in your own journey, but so diligent in helping me along in mine. I hope you've at least managed to save a handful of coins since coming here.

TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_079<tab>If we're going forward with this, I must ask that you spare Yak T'el future digging. I wouldn't sacrifice the region's natural beauty in my quest, nor damage another's home.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_080<tab>There has to be a different way...but I shall require time to find it.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_081<tab>When I do, I only ask that you be there to help, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Can I count on you?
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SHUNYE_000_082<tab>Thank you, truly. I'll have to sell a good portion of my stock to pay back the debt I'll owe you after all is said and done.
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SYSTEM_000_083<tab>Shunye is thrilled with your efforts. He now considers you a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Glorious Gatherer<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>!
TEXT_KINGLA406_04994_SYSTEM_000_084<tab>The next request will be available from Shunye upon reaching level 100 as a botanist or miner.
